intro: Parrya pinnatifida var. glabra, commonly known as the smoothleaf parrya, is a herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant features finely divided, pinnately arranged leaves that are smooth and glabrous, giving it its varietal name. It produces small, white to greenish flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
